pageList.title: Overview
des: TourBox is a powerful, easy-to-use creative tool dedicatedly designed for creators.
Simply by matching creative software’s shortcuts to TourBox, the difficulty of operating the software can be greatly reduced, lifting your work efficiency and user experience to a new level.
TourBox allows you to design in the most intuitive way, no matter it is adjusting brush tools, controlling image, editing video and audio, adjusting parameters, and switching between tools.
TourBox is equipped with a Knob, a Scroll, a Dial and other eleven buttons.
Either a rotation of a wheel or a press of a button can initiate keyboard Shortcuts or functions built in TourBox’s console.
You can also use the Knob, Scroll, Dial or buttons independently or in combinations to achieve a variety of functions.

pageList.title: Install TourBox Console
text: 1. Visit TourBox official website: https://www.tourboxtech.com/downloads.html#/to download the Drive based on your computer version as well as the latest TourBox Console application.
2. Run the Driver and wait until the installation completes.

pageList.title: Connect TourBox to a Computer
summary: 1. Open TourBox console, and a prompt will remind you to connect TourBox to your computer.
2. Connect the USB-C port on TourBox to the USB-A port on your computer with the USB cable, and ensure the LED indicator is on.
3. TourBox console will automatically enter the main interface after it is successfully connected to your computer.

pageList.title: Preset List
des: You can save and manage multiple presets in Preset List, such as creating, deleting, importing, exporting, sorting presets, and editing preset tags.
Select a preset to load it.
Two default presets for Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Lightroom have been imported to the Preset List.

pageList.title: Preset Settings
des: Columns in Preset Settings correspond to the functions of the wheels, the buttons and the combinations. Click a column, and you can adjust the according settings.
In the pop-up menu, you can view, search and choose desired functions, or adjust settings with shortcuts on your keyboard.

pageList.title: Brush Control
des: To adjust the brush size, rotate the Knob .
To adjust brush opacity, hold the Tall button and rotate the Knob simultaneously.
To adjust brush hardness, hold the Short button and rotate the Knob simultaneously.
To adjust brush flow, hold the Top button and rotate the Knob simultaneously.

text: You can use any brush tools as well as stamp tools , healing tools eraser tools more.
des: To achieve functions such as eyedropper, clone stamp, display just one layer, hold the Tall button and click your mouse simultaneously.
To switch between foreground and background colors, double-click the Tall button .

pageList.title: Image Control
des: To zoom in and out, roll the Scroll .
To let images fit the screen, press the Scroll .
To drag images, hold the Short button and drag your mouse.

pageList.title: Switch between tools
des: You can switch between brush tools stamp tools , healing tools , eraser tools with the Dpad buttons .
To switch between marquee tools lasso tools , quick selection / magic wand tools and crop tools , hold the Side button , then press the Dpad buttons .
To switch between tool submenus, hold the Dpad buttons and roll the Scroll simultaneously.
Open HUD, and you can check the according tools mapped to each Dpad button at any time.
To open or close HUD, hold the Tour button .
You can drag HUD to any position of the screen with your mouse, and right click the HUD to change the HUD settings.

pageList.title: Select Areas
text: When using tools such as marquee, lasso, magic wand to select an area,
des: Hold the Top button , and drag a box with your mouse to enlarge a selected area.
Hold the Tall button , and drag a box with your mouse to narrow a selected area.
Hold the Top button , and press the Dpad buttons to achieve functions such as feathering, filling, inverse selection and free transform.
Hold the Side button and Tall button to cancel selecting an area.

pageList.title: Parameter Adjustment
des: Click any parameter bar, and you can adjust parameters with the Dial .

pageList.title: Other Functions
des: Press the Side Button and Short button - Save (Ctrl+ S)
Double-click Short button - Undo/Redo.
Press C1/ C2 button - Step backward/Step forward
Hold the Tall button , and roll the Scroll simultaneously to switch between layers.
Hold the Side button , and roll the Scroll simultaneously to switch between blend modes.

pageList.title: Custom Settings
des: You can custom the Photoshop preset in Preset Settings according to your preference.
Columns in Preset Settings correspond to the functions of the wheels, the buttons and the combinations. Click a column, and you can adjust the according settings.
In the pop-up menu, you can view, search and choose desired functions, or adjust settings with shortcuts on your keyboard.
You can press buttons or rotate wheels on TourBox to indicate the related columns immediately.

pageList.title: Lightroom Preset Settings
text: TourBox Console 2.0 adds a complete set of Lightroom-related built-in functions that allow digital creators to adjust Lightroom sliders without using a mouse.
In addition, digital creators can assign any preferred functions to the Tour button .
des: Note: Please reboot Lightroom when you activate TourBox Console 2.0 version for the time.

text: Default Lightroom Presets features in TourBox Console v 2.0:
des: Press buttons to select sliders. Rotate the Knob to alter values.
Rotation of the Dial or Knob can be configured to adjust values of any selected sliders.
Press Tour button to reset selected sliders to initial values.
Rotate the Scroll to quick select the colors in HSL setting.
Press the Scroll to switch among H/S/L, then rotate the Knob to adjust the selected slider.

text: Four most commonly used functions in LR Basic Panel can be controlled by Prime four buttons on TourBox.
text2: Press the button to select slider then rotate the Knob to adjust selected slider.
des: Top Button : Temperature
Side Button : Tint
Tall Button : Exposure
Short Button : Contrast

text: Other 9 sliders in LR Basic Panel can be controlled by Dpad and its combinations.
des: Press the button to select slider then rotate the Knob to adjust selected slider.

text: HUD can stay on the screen and display functions of Dpad and its combinations.
Press the Scroll to switch among H/S/L.Rotate the Scroll to select color.
des: Then rotate the Knob to adjust selected slider.

text: Hold Tall button + rotate the Knob to adjust sharpening amount.
Hold Short button + rotate the Knob to control Post-crop Vignettes.
Point your cursor to parameter adjustment sliders (clicking is not necessary) to adjust the slider value with the Dial on TourBox.
Press C1 button to view Before and After.

pageList.title: Create Presets
des: Click icon to create a new preset in the Preset List.
Name the preset and choose a preset type in the pop-up window.
Preset types include Photoshop preset, Lightroom preset, and blank preset.

pageList.title: Preset Settings
des: You can configure or adjust presets in Preset Settings according to your preference.
Columns in Preset Settings correspond to the functions of the wheels, the buttons and the combinations. Click a column, and you can adjust the according settings.
In the pop-up menu, you can view, search and choose desired functions, or adjust settings with shortcuts on your keyboard.
You can press buttons or rotate wheels on TourBox to indicate the related columns immediately.

pageList.title: Create Tags for Shortcuts
des: You can create tags for shortcuts when configuring presets. Click icon and you can add or edit tags, click OK to save the tags.
You can use tags to describe the according shortcuts functions in the software.
If a shortcut has a tag, the tag will be shown on TourBox console, otherwise the console will show the shortcut name.
Click icon on the left side of a preset name, you can enter the tag management interface to add or manage tags in batches for current preset.

pageList.title: Import/Export Presets
text: To import or export a preset, click icon on the left side of the preset name.

des: New presets will be available on official TourBox website for you to download and use.
You can also export your preset and share it with others, or download and use presets shared by other users in TourBox Forum.

pageList.title: HUD
des: As a proxy for Dpad buttons, the HUD could constantly stay on the screen for you to check functions mapped to each button of the Dpad at any time.
Press the Top button or Side button , the functions of the Top button and Dpad button , or the functions of the Side button and the Dpad button will be shown on HUD.
You can use the tray menu to Open/Close the HUD.
You can configure any button to Open/Close the HUD (built-in function) quickly.
You can drag the HUD to any position of the screen with your mouse, and right click the HUD to change the HUD settings.

pageList.title: Guide
text: Guide shows three sections of TourBox for users to view presets quickly.
You can configure any button as Open/Close the Guide (built-in function) to help your quickly check all your TourBox settings.
des: Rotation Section: Knob, Scroll and Dial.
Prime Four Section: Tall button, Short button, Top button and Side button.
Kit Section: Dpad, C1/C2.

pageList.title: Automatic Switch between Presets
des: Switch on “Auto Switch” for switching presets automatically.
Link the presets to the respective software.
Open Linked software (Automatically switch to the respective preset without interruption).

pageList.title: Quick Switch between Presets
des: In Preset List, you could mark the preset as a favorite by lighting up the icon on the right side of the presets.
You can configure any button as Switch Preset (built-in function) to shift favorite presets.
Drag the preset column to arrange the presets order.
